subject: Negotiation
title: Building Coalitions Before the Meeting
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Building Coalitions Before the Meeting.

hook.text: The negotiation is often won or lost before anyone sits at the table. Alliances are built in advance.

buildup.text: Coalition building means securing allies who support your position before formal negotiations begin.

discovery.text: Arriving with allies signals strength and isolates the opposition â€” shifting the balance of power.

twist.text: The most effective coalitions include unexpected allies â€” support from an opponent's friends is devastating.

climax.text: Map the stakeholders. Identify natural allies. Build the coalition before the meeting, not during it.

punchline.text: The deal is shaped by the alliances built before anyone enters the room.
